bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. Combined Designation of feng 風 , wind, and re 熱 , heat, with the latter dominating. Qian jin yi fang 千金翼方 21: 熱風上沖，頭面上癢、鼻中癢 , “ Heat wind rushes upward. Head and face itch, and there is itching in the nose”.

②Miscellaneous Pathological Condition resulting from re feng 熱風， heat wind . Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 8: 竹瀝飲 子，患熱風者，必先用此，制其熱毒 , “The drink with zhu li is the first to be applied by patients suffering from heat wind . It subdues its heat poison”. Such a Pathological Condition belongs to the category of feng fei 風痱 , wind disablement. Jie wei yuan sou 解圍元藪 1: 熱風， 此症初起目脫、惡風、寒戰，鼻中常流黃濁涕，或咳吐膿血，鼻崩、眼 坍、耳塞，而氣閉不通，救遲則死 , “ Heat wind . This condition begins with a feeling as if the eyes were bursting. [Patients] have an aversion to wind. They feel cold and shiver. Yellow, turbid snivel flows out of the nose continuously. Sometimes [patients] vomit pus and blood. Their nose breaks down. Their eyes collapse. The ears are blocked, and the qi is closed in and cannot pass. If help is late [the patient] will die”. This Pathological Condition is a heat type ma feng 麻風 , numbness wind, i.e. leprosy. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 refers to pathological conditions associated with heat wind, such as re feng shen yang 熱風身癢 , heat wind with body itching; re feng shou zu bu sui 熱風手足不遂 , heat wind with hands and feet not moving according to one’s will; re feng shui zhang 熱風水脹 , heat wind with edema.
